Operations.description: A list of operations that are part of the batch.

items.description: Represents the output of a BatchRead operation.

GetLinkAttributes.description: Retrieves attributes that are associated with a typed link.

AttributeNames.description: A list of attribute names whose values will be retrieved.

TypedLinkSpecifier.description: Allows a typed link specifier to be accepted as input.

IdentityAttributeValues.description: Identifies the attribute value to update.

items.description: Identifies the attribute name and value for a typed link.

AttributeName.description: The attribute name of the typed link.

Value.description: The value for the typed link.

SourceObjectReference.description: Identifies the source object that the typed link will attach to.

Selector.description:
A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

  • $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object’s identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier

  • /some/path - Identifies the object based on path

  • #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call

TargetObjectReference.description: Identifies the target object that the typed link will attach to.

Selector.description:
A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

  • $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object’s identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier

  • /some/path - Identifies the object based on path

  • #SomeBatchReference - Identifies the object in a batch call

TypedLinkFacet.description: Identifies the typed link facet that is associated with the typed link.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

TypedLinkName.description: The unique name of the typed link facet.

GetObjectAttributes.description: Retrieves attributes within a facet that are associated with an object.

AttributeNames.description: List of attribute names whose values will be retrieved.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object whose attributes will be retrieved.

SchemaFacet.description: Identifier for the facet whose attributes will be retrieved. See SchemaFacet for details.

SchemaArn.description: The ARN of the schema that contains the facet with no minor component. See arns and In-Place Schema Upgrade for a description of when to provide minor versions.

Selector.description:

ListAttachedIndices.description: Lists indices attached to an object.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

TargetReference.description: A reference to the object that has indices attached.

Selector.description:
A path selector supports easy selection of an object by the parent/child links leading to it from the directory root. Use the link names from each parent/child link to construct the path. Path selectors start with a slash (/) and link names are separated by slashes. For more information about paths, see Access Objects. You can identify an object in one of the following ways:

  • $ObjectIdentifier - An object identifier is an opaque string provided by Amazon Cloud Directory. When creating objects, the system will provide you with the identifier of the created object. An object’s identifier is immutable and no two objects will ever share the same object identifier

ListIncomingTypedLinks.description: Returns a paginated list of all the incoming TypedLinkSpecifier information for an object. It also supports filtering by typed link facet and identity attributes. For more information, see Typed Links.

FilterAttributeRanges.description: Provides range filters for multiple attributes. When providing ranges to typed link selection, any inexact ranges must be specified at the end. Any attributes that do not have a range specified are presumed to match the entire range.

items.description: Identifies the range of attributes that are used by a specified filter.

AttributeName.description: The unique name of the typed link attribute.

Range.description: The range of attribute values that are being selected.

EndMode.description: The inclusive or exclusive range end.

EndValue.description: The attribute value to terminate the range at.

StartMode.description: The inclusive or exclusive range start.

StartValue.description: The value to start the range at.

FilterTypedLink.description: Filters are interpreted in the order of the attributes on the typed link facet, not the order in which they are supplied to any API calls.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that is associated with the schema. For more information, see arns.

TypedLinkName.description: The unique name of the typed link facet.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

ObjectReference.description: The reference that identifies the object whose attributes will be listed.

ListIndex.description: Lists objects attached to the specified index.

IndexReference.description: The reference to the index to list.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

RangesOnIndexedValues.description: Specifies the ranges of indexed values that you want to query.

AttributeKey.description: The key of the attribute that the attribute range covers.

FacetName.description: The name of the facet that the attribute exists within.

SchemaArn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema that contains the facet and attribute.

Range.description: The range of attribute values being selected.

EndMode.description: The inclusive or exclusive range end.

EndValue.description: The attribute value to terminate the range at.

StartMode.description: The inclusive or exclusive range start.

StartValue.description: The value to start the range at.

ListObjectAttributes.description: Lists all attributes that are associated with an object.

FacetFilter.description: Used to filter the list of object attributes that are associated with a certain facet.

SchemaArn.description: The ARN of the schema that contains the facet with no minor component. See arns and In-Place Schema Upgrade for a description of when to provide minor versions.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of items to be retrieved in a single call. This is an approximate number.

ObjectReference.description: Reference of the object whose attributes need to be listed.

ListObjectChildren.description: Returns a paginated list of child objects that are associated with a given object.

ObjectReference.description: Reference of the object for which child objects are being listed.

ListObjectParentPaths.description: Retrieves all available parent paths for any object type such as node, leaf node, policy node, and index node objects. For more information about objects, see Directory Structure.

ListPolicyAttachments.description: Returns all of the ObjectIdentifiers to which a given policy is attached.

PolicyReference.description: The reference that identifies the policy object.

Selector.description:

LookupPolicy.description: Lists all policies from the root of the Directory to the object specified. If there are no policies present, an empty list is returned. If policies are present, and if some objects don't have the policies attached, it returns the ObjectIdentifier for such objects. If policies are present, it returns ObjectIdentifier, policyId, and policyType. Paths that don't lead to the root from the target object are ignored. For more information, see Policies.

MaxResults.description: The maximum number of results to retrieve.

ObjectReference.description: Reference that identifies the object whose policies will be looked up.
